kaninator.io
Class MapFactory

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.io.MapFactory

public final class MapFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Creates a Map object from a text file. Also creates the StaticObjects contained in the Map. Reads a text file consisting of numbers with whitespaces between them. The odd numbers represent the height of the current tile, the even ones represent type of the tile. Example:
0 0 0 0 0 0
0 0 3 1 0 0
0 0 0 0 0 0
This represents a map of 9 tiles, the one in the middle is at a height of 3 and is of the tile type 0. The rest are at the height 0 and of the type 0.

Author:
phedman
See Also:
Map, StaticObject

getTileSize

public static double getTileSize()
Returns the internal size (in the isometric coordinate system) of a tile. The size is set as a constant.

Returns:
The size of the tile in isometric coordinate units.

public static double getTileHeight()
Returns the internal height (in the isometric coordinate system) of a tile. The size is set as a constant.

readMap

public static Map readMap(java.lang.String filepath)
                   throws MapException
Reads the file found at the filepath, parses it, creates the necessary StaticObjects, and creates a game map from them.

Parameters:
filepath - The path that points to the map file.
Returns:
A the Map created from the text file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the file is not found or cannot be read.
MapException

parseLine

private static java.util.ArrayList<StaticObject> parseLine(java.lang.String line,
                                                           int y)
Parses a single line of map data, creates the needed StaticObjects and adds them to an ArrayList.

Parameters:
line - The line containing the map data.
y - The number of the line.
Returns:
An ArrayList containing the newly created StaticObjects that correspond to the map data in the line.
